'Lady in the Water' is a science fiction film directed by Kevin Smith. The movie follows apartment building superintendent Cleveland Heep as he rescues what he thinks is a young woman from the pool he maintains. Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Dear John" as a captivating and suspenseful movie.

The plot of "Dear John" revolves around a young woman who is about to get married. However, before she can officially become married, she receives a message from the man she will be getting married to, informing her that he has changed his mind about the marriage and wants to end it.

This unexpected turn of events leaves the young woman wondering what to do next and if there is still any hope for the future between herself and the man she was about to get married to.

I recommend "Hotel Rwanda" as it tells a powerful and emotional story during one of the most devastating conflicts in modern history. The acting, particularly from Nick Nolte and Sophie Okonedo, is superb and helps to bring the reality of this event to life on screen.
On the other hand, I do not recommend "End of Watch" as it does not have the same emotional impact or relevance as "Hotel Rwanda". However, if you are looking for a good action movie with some great stunts and fight scenes, then "End of Watch" might be worth checking out.
